column1: length ball around off, lunges forward and defends it back towards the bowler
fired in with the arm this time, on middle and leg, punched towards short midwicket who dives to his left but cannot make a stop. A single to long-on
fuller around off, presses forward and defends it towards extra cover
length ball on the stumps, goes back and flicks it towards short midwicket
length outside off, comes slower off the wicket, Bairstow defends it from the back foot, extra bounce means the ball hits near the splice
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks it under his eyes
fuller around off and swinging away, 137 kph with the breeze, Roy comes forward and leaves it alone
length ball on the stumps, stays back and defends on the off side
length ball around off, gets behind the line and taps it towards long-on, that's seven dots in a row
lovely on-drive, fuller on the stumps, Roy comes on the front foot and just punches it past the non-striker with a straight bat
length ball around off this time, corrects himself Mashrafe, Roy stays back and turns it towards square leg for one
length ball around off, looks to drive on the up, gets an inside edge on to the pads
length ball on the stumps, Roy looks to smash it across the line, shows his stumps but ends up inside-edging it on to his shoes
a touch fuller this time, pushed towards mid-off
length ball outside off, goes back and punches hard, a diving stop by the extra cover fielder
length ball outside off, manages to squeeze it past the extra cover fielder this time, a single
length ball around off and middle, pushed back
length ball on the stumps, comes forward and defends it back towards the bowler
length ball outside off, Roy was walking at the bowler, gets too close to the line though and decides to leave in the end
length ball on the stumps, Roy gets behind and taps it towards the right of mid-on
length ball around middle, Bairstow was looking to work it on the leg side, gets a leading edge but well short of mid-off
length outside off and swatted towards midwicket, finally off the mark, took him nine balls
length ball around off, stands back and punches it back towards the bowler
short of length and angling on to the pads, looks to flick and misses, struck high on the thigh
length ball around off, goes back and punches it towards short midwicket
this one kept a bit low, and also Bairstow played back when he should have been forward, manages to get his bat down in time in the end
length ball around off, punched off the back foot towards mid-off, gets a single
length ball angling in, punched once again towards mid-off for one more
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards the left of the bowler, Shakib dives across but cannot prevent the single
uses his feet and drives this fuller delivery past mid-off, the fielder puts in the chase and manages to pull it just inside
length ball around off, was looking to make some room and hit through the off side, but gets an inside edge past the stumps for four
fuller on middle and leg, pushes it towards short midwicket
just away from the short midwicket fielder, was a length ball around off, Roy stays back and chips it in the air, it was on the right of Mustafizur who cannot reach there, Roy gets a boundary
short of length around off, turns it towards short midwicket with wrists, straight towards short midwicket
length ball on the stumps, punches it towards mid-on for a quick single
length ball around off, flicked away towards midwicket, the fielder puts in the chase but fumbles, allows an easy two
fuller around off and driven through extra cover, timing, placement all perfect with that shot
Shakib shortens his length and bowls one on the pads, flicked away towards square leg for one more
length ball around off, Bairstow is once again on the back foot, punches it towards long-on
length ball around off, Roy was looking to open up but the ball comes slower off the surface, mistimes it towards the bowler
gets it right this time, short of length on the stumps and pulled away towards deep midwicket for another four
flatter and quicker around off, Roy once again stays back but finds short midwicket with the punch
starts with a fuller on around off, easy pickings for Bairstow who drives it past the bowler for four
an offcutter it looked like, length around off, Bairstow was looking to drive on the up, mistimes it down the ground
short of length outside off, goes for the pull, a bit of thick edge towards the right of deep-backward square leg who keeps it to three
Roy once again walking towards the bowler, length ball but wide outside off, goes further away from the batsman with the breeze

Roy is once again down the track, cannot reach to the pitch of the ball and ends up pushing at it, gets a leading edge between point and cover, Roy is looking for the fourth one as the fielder has to throw against the wind but will have to be satisfied with three only
fuller around off and Saifuddin pays the price once more, driven past mid-off for four
short of length outside off, pulled away towards deep square leg but only a single. Still 16 from that over
tossed up around off, Bairstow comes forward and blocks

length ball around off, Bairstow goes back and flicks it towards deep midwicket, the deep square leg fielder had to run all the way to prevent reaching it to the boundary but the batsmen run four themselves
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and defended
pitched up once again, defended from the front foot
fuller outside off, comes forward and opens the face this time to run it towards point
slightly short in length, Bairstow goes back and pulls it towards the vacant deep midwicket, four more to him
length ball outside off, punched firmly towards extra cover
short of length outside off, looks to pull it off the front foot, the ball hits the toe-end and rolls towards midwicket
fuller on the stumps, flicked away towards deep midwicket for one
fuller around off and lofted over mid-off, not the best of the connections, the bat turning in his hands, but enough on it to reach the boundary line
length ball on the stumps, cramping the batsman a bit, Roy is happy to defend this time
a touch fuller and on the pads, Roy misses the flick and the ball brushes the pads. Mushfiqur puts in the dive and gets a hand to it
short of the length at the batsman, Roy pulls it towards square leg
fuller around middle and off, Bairstow comes forward and flicks it across the line towards midwicket, once again no fielder there, deep square leg cannot reach there in time
length ball around off, stands tall and taps it towards cover-point
short of length outside off, Bairstow, who is batting with an open stance, taps it behind point for a couple more
slower one on the pads, flicked away towards backward square leg
short of length at the batsman, Roy pulls it down towards fine leg
short of length around off, punches it towards mid-off from the back foot
fuller around off, and Roy just lofts it over the bowler's head, straight bat, no fuss, and this one goes all the way - first six of the game
cheekily done this time, length ball outside off, Roy waits for it and guides it past the keeper for four, that's fifty off 38 balls for him
length ball on the stumps, stays back and punches it towards long-on
length ball around off, punched back towards the bowler and it bounces over his head, Saifuddin jumps and gets his fingertips to it, the mid-off tidies it up
length ball around off, punches it towards extra cover off the back foot
length ball fired down the leg side, goes for the flick but misses
length ball around middle, goes back and chops it towards extra cover
a touch fuller and angled in, looks to drive through covers, gets an inside edge towards short midwicket
a touch fuller around off, comes forward to defend, doesn't find the middle though
fuller around off, goes back and looks to punch through the off side, gets an inside edge towards short fine leg
fuller around off, pushed back from the front foot
fuller, just outside off, Bairstow was looking to turn it towards the leg side, gets an outside edge towards short third man
length ball around off, stays in his crease and steers it towards cover-point
length ball around off, Roy once again stays back and chops it towards point
fuller and wider outside off, Roy opens the face and steers it towards point, straight towards the fielder
fuller around off and driven firmly but cannot get past the extra cover fielder, four dots
fuller around off and this time Roy takes the aerial route, over extra cover for four this time
short of length outside off, steers it behind point for one and keeps the strike
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and defends
length ball around off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
length ball on the pads, flicked towards short fine leg, no single though
slower through the air, 77 kph, Roy was early into the shot, ends up chipping over the bowler's head
fuller and angled in, pushed back towards the bowler
length ball on the pads, flicked away past the short fine leg fielder, he chases it all the way but the ball was always going to win
Roy comes down the track, giving himself some room, but Mustafizur fires it full and wide outside off, Roy cannot reach there
short of length outside off, dabs it towards third man
length ball around off, an offcutter from the bowler, Bairstow adjusts and opens the face of the bat to guide it towards point, a bit of fumble there means an easy single
fuller and in the slot, Roy bends his front knee and smashes it through covers

a bit of a mix-up, but the throw is at the wrong end, and Bairstow makes it easily in the end. Coming to the ball, it fuller outside off, Roy steered towards extra cover and turned back for the second, Bairstow was busy watching the ball but the throw is to the keeper, where Roy was always going to make it
short of length on the body, pulled away towards fine leg
length ball around off, goes back and cuts it towards covers
length ball on the stumps, punched it towards long-on for an easy single
length ball around off, comes forward and drives it towards the right of the bowler who dives across to make a stop
length ball around off, flicked away towards short midwicket
length ball around off, goes deep and turns it towards the right of short midwicket for a quick single
fuller on the pads, looks to flick but misses, an appeal for lbw but perhaps was going down
into the toes, and flicked to the leg side
round the wicket, cramping Roy for room on the pads, and a leading edge squirts out to point
fuller length, pushed with an open face into the off side
cracked on the up, gathered at long-off. Another forceful stroke to a good-length ball
a baseball slug off the legs! Flinging the bat across the line, nailing the connection, bissecting the fielders at backward square. Not short, not full, just sloggable

better length, angled across the right-hander, pushed down to long-off, but there's a grim misfield and a stolen bonus run .. in fact, it wasn't a misfield, Shakib chose to throw the ball to mid-on instead of the keeper!
tucked into the gap
looped onto the pads, Bairstow looking for his fifty, but can't pierce the gap
no problems this time! Nurdled into the gap behind square, back they sprint for the second, and Bairstow's tournament is up and running with his first World Cup fifty
thumped into the covers
advancing down the wicket this time, looking for something ambitious over deep midwicket, but beaten in the flight this time
retreats to leg, climbs into the flog through the covers! Shimmering footwork, and that gallops through the infield. This is getting brisk

leading edge into the covers, and a very sharp take! What a timely breakthrough! Mortaza found some extra lift from round the wicket, Bairstow attempted a nudge to leg, but the ball popped up to short cover, where it was gobbled brilliantly by a sprint and dive from Mehedy. The stand is broken, Bangladesh have a glimmer at last!
banged in short, rolls the wrists on the pull to get off the mark straightaway
tucked off the pads once more, an easy single to deep midwicket
very full, off-stump line, met with a vertical blade and a push to mid-on
back of a length, a slower ball, tapped to gully
flicked to leg once more, well fielded at midwicket
fenced on the up to mid-on, another fumble gifts the single
sliding back and across, eased to Tamim at mid-on again, who gathers well this time to ironic cheers from the crowd
round the wicket, looped onto a middle-and-off line, pushed firmly down the pitch
shuffling at the crease, trying to create an angle into the covers, and that's a sharp single, with Roy on the back foot. So was the fielder...
nurdled off the pads to midwicket, England just ticking along for now
making room again, confident footwork and a scything slash out to deep cover. Five singles, that's steady from England and Mehidy
on the up, deep in the crease, pushed to the on side
banged in short outside off, attempted slap on the up to short cover, but can't time the stroke at the top of the bounce
thumped to mid-off, more intentful timing
on the legs, whipped behind square
pushed into the off side
another measured single into the off side. Roy is just ticking over for now. He's been so cross with himself for giving away his starts recently...
flicked off the legs to midwicket once more
round the wicket, leg-stump line, clipped behind square
on the legs once more, this is a constrictive line, nudged with a closed face to the leg side
sure enough, Roy is tempted to try something different. Lines up the reverse sweep and is thumped on the pad! But outside the line, no review
that's a fractional drag-down from Mehidy, and Roy rocks back to launch it over the leg side! Solid batting
worked off the pads once more, down to long-on. Tick, tick ... boom?
hooping angle from round the wicket, an attempted thrash through the covers, but inside-edged
punched from under the eyeline, out to mid-on
flicked off the pads again, out towards the long deep midwicket boundary
cramped for room on the legs again, another pushed single to mid-on
leaning back for a chop out to point
once again, targeting that leg-stump line, desperate to avoid offering any width to Roy's long levers. So he accepts the nudge off the hips and picks off another single
angled across the right-hander, chopped down into the off-side, and beats the diving keeper before third man tidies up
rising to meet the delivery on the back foot, off-stump line, open-faced dab to third man
eases back and across, to nudge another leg-stump delivery into the gap behind square. Sharp running, but not quite sharp enough to come back for the second
tighter line, back of a length, draws a respectful block, with the third man region plugged for now...
stretching into the drive, swinging a touch, Root chases with the drive but can't time it
on the legs again, another cherry-picked single to backward square.
tapped off the toes to the leg side
crashed with intent into the leg side once more, latching onto a fractional change of length, but it's a long boundary and not quite timed
over the wicket now to Root, who meets a full-length ball with a clip to long-on
rising up onto the toes, punched past short cover, and more really sloppy fielding! An easy single, followed by a wayward shy past the stumps, and nearly a third overthrow too... whoops
back of a length from round the wicket again, outside off, firmly clumped down to long-off, to move to 95...
nibbles off the seam on a full length, thumps the pad as Root falls across his stance, but no review for that, sliding past leg
onto the front foot, high-elbowed push to mid-off
squeezed for room on the leg stump, another useful dot as Roy tries to make the angle
down the leg side, it's a bonus run, but Roy is livid, as it was back of a length, and the slenderest tickle of bat would have been four all the way
firmly cracked on the up into the covers, lovely straight blade, seizing on the merest hint of off-side line. But the sweeper limits the damage
flowing drive, all along the ground to long-off, Root returns the compliment

short, pulled, and away to the rope via another misfield! Jason Roy has his century, but takes a moment to make sure he's not left a permanent dent in the umpire, whom he completely wipes out while completing his run! Joel Wilson is fine. On we go!
worked to the leg side again
a rank long-hop, 126kph, hoisted out through the leg side
short and wide, chopped to third man
gives himself room, showing the stumps, and slapping a drive through the line to long-off
a firm punch back down the pitch, but that is well stopped in the bowler's followthrough. Mid-on tidies up
back of a length, outside off, another whittle to third man
chopped down into the crease, a bit cramped for room on the back foot
very full, angled in from round the wicket, tucked up for room on the attempted nurdle through third man
gets the angle this time, just opening the face on a good length, dabbed to third man off the back foot
walks across the stumps for the affempted flick over the keeper's head, but can't lay bat on ball
on the toes, flicked fine, and more sluggish fielding on the long square boundary allows them back for the second
back of a length on a leg-stump line, cracked out to backward point
banged in short, a slightly top-edgy slap of a pull, but the long boundary is so long that the fielders rather get lost in a sea of green. Lands safe
punched to long-on
swivels into a pull, a bottom edge into the ankles ... lots of intent, lacking in execution on that occasion
eased on the up to midwicket
on the pads, clipped to short midwicket. No way through there
short and wide, Roy reaches for the pull and drags it to the leg side in front of square
very full, full face of the bat in response, Saifuddin half-stops with a leap in his followthrough
utterly lashed through the covers! Shakib's return is rudely greeted with a full-faced slap!
goes for the exact same shot, with the exact same result! Round the wicket, into the arc, and pummelled through the covers!
Shakib tightens his line, and is battered over long-on!
pushed into the off side, and up comes the 200...
worked into the covers for another single
wide line outside off, Roy reaches with a cross-batted mow, and finds the single to square leg
low full toss, a muffed slog to deep midwicket
speared into the legs, can't work the angle but accepts the single into the leg side
inside-edged drive! Root's knock is sawn off by a slower ball, perhaps he was through the shot too soon. Respite at last for Bangladesh, but I wonder if we might see Jos Buttler now?

advancing out of his crease, that is arrow-straight but a long way down the pitch! Bangladesh are reviewing! It was an attempted flick to leg, no bat involved ... was it past the 3m mark though ... nope, but it was missing leg! Just starting to swing at the point of impact, which may be why he missed it
flicked to the leg side
chipped off the pads, in the air for a moment, but short of the man at short backward square
looping into the legs, worked to short midwicket
on the back foot, nurdled to the leg side, the leg-stump line continues to have a limited impact
closing the face on impact, tucked to the leg side once more
shuffling back and across, can't connect properly as Mehidy gathers
this is turning into a tidy over, clipped off the pads once again with no great intent
more ambitious to finish the over, hopping back into the crease to make room for a slashing drive, but only as far as wide mid-off
length ball around off, pushes it towards long-on off the back foot
length ball around off, stays back and pushes it towards sweeper cover
fuller on the stumps, flicked away but straight to the straight-ish midwicket
length ball around off, drops it towards point and scampers through for a quick single
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards long-on
down the track and smashes it towards long-on, one-bounce to the fielder
length ball from around the wicket, Roy goes down the track and lofts it over wide long-on, 97 metres that one
and again, this one went high in the air but still enough to sail over the long-on boundary

make that three in a row, Roy is just enjoying himself out there, was a length ball, does that matter to Roy! He skips down and goes over deep midwicket, 90 metres long. Roy reaches 150 in style, off 120 balls
looks to go for the fourth one but Mehidy has pushed it a bit wider, Roy came down and looked to go straight, the ball hit the outer half of the bat and Mashrafe Mortaza settled under it extra cover
length around off, dabs it towards backward point for one
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller on the pads, flicked away towards deep-backward square leg
length outside off, stays in his crease and cuts it away towards deep extra cover
dropped short this time, Buttler goes back and pulls it towards deep midwicket, only a single
length ball on the stumps, Morgan punches it back towards the bowler
length again, Morgan goes back this time and flicks it towards midwicket
length ball on the stumps, flicked away behind square for one more
length ball angled across from around the wicket, guides it towards short third man
fuller on the pads, misses the flick and is hit on the pad, an appeal for lbw but was going down
fuller around off and middle, drives it towards extra cover
length outside off, pushed towards sweeper cover for one
length ball on the stumps, defended from the crease
fuller on the pads, flicked away towards deep square leg
Buttler uses his feet this time, gets to the pitch of the ball and lofts it over wide long-on for his first six
backs away this time and cuts this length ball past the cover fielder for four more
a low full toss on the pads, clipped away in front of square
length ball around off, stays back and punches it towards long-off
what a shot! Length ball on the stumps, Buttler goes back and pulls it over long-on, all the way for a six. They need a new ball
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards midwicket for a single
fuller on the stumps, digs it out towards long-on
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards cover-point
length outside off, cuts it away, a misfield by the point fielder allows a couple
length ball around middle and leg, pushed towards square leg
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, punched towards long-on for one
length ball around off, defended from the back foot
fuller around off, driven firmly but straight towards mid-off
too full this time and Morgan takes full advantages, goes aerial and clears mid-off with ease, 82 metres
length around off, taps it towards point from the crease
length ball around middle, pushes it towards long-on off the back foot
fuller on the pads, clipped uppishly towards deep midwicket, a bit of a fumble but the batsmen settle for one
fired but down the leg side, has to be bowled again
full on the stumps, digs it out towards midwicket for a quick single
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, punched towards long-off from the back foot
fuller on the stumps and Buttler has flicked this through midwicket for four, the wide long-on fielder has no chacne to cut it off
fuller again and Buttler goes again, this time the wide long-on fielder manages to reach there, puts in the slide to keep it to two
a full toss on the pads, flicked away towards midwicket
a full toss outside off, hits it into the ground and the ball bounces over the bowler, a single to long-off
length ball but sliding down the leg side, Morgan cannot connect the flick, called a wide
fuller around off, driven towards long-on for one
fuller around middle and off, drives it past the point fielder, comes for the second and makes it easily
golf swing this time from Buttler, was a touch fuller around off and Buttler tees away, stand and deliver, 85 metres over long-on. New balls please!
a slower short ball, just around off, Buttler was looking to pull but had to check his shot, ends up defending it down the ground
short of length outside off, pulls it away towards deep midwicket for a couple
length outside off, perhaps a touch short, Morgan cuts it past the point fielder for four
length ball around off, punches it towards extra cover off the back foot, Buttler is quick to respond and completes the run easily
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg, scampers back for the second and that's his fifty, off just 33 balls
full and wide outside off, reaches out for it and pushes it towards the left of Shakib who moves quickly and hits the stumps direct. They are checking upstairs but Buttler was just in
moves across and flicks this fuller delivery towards midwicket
down the leg side, looks to paddle it away but misses
fuller outside off, hits it towards sweeper cover for one, Buttler's really struggling there
short of length outside off, goes back and pulls it in front of squares, hobbles through for a single
short of length around off, pulls it towards deep-backward square leg
fuller outside off, backs away and squeezes it towards deep extra cover, but he has stepped over the line, a big no-ball
length ball around off, goes for the pull but top-edges it behind the wicket, Mushfiqur runs towards his right and catches it but those don't count
short of length outside off, Buttler goes off the ground and plays a tennis forehand towards the bowler, doesn't get the timing right
fuller outside off, opens the face of the bat to steer it towards point
short of length outside off, pulled away towards deep square leg
length ball on the pads, glanced towards short fine leg
down the track and lofted over the bowler's head, a flat six for Morgan, 79 metres
almost a yorker from Shakib this time, Morgan jams his bat at it, an inside edge on to his shoe
length outside off, chops it towards backward point
fuller around off, flat-bats it towards long-off

length ball outside off, Morgan was looking to back away, Shakib fires it wide outside off and the batsman can just look at it go through into the keeper's gloves. Morgan was expecting a wide, doesn't get
more tennis than cricket from Buttler, short of length outside off, Buttler backs away a bit and smashes it over extra cover, all the way for a six

fuller on the pads and flicked away by Buttler, it looked like it was going all the way but Soumya Sarkar does well at deep square leg, a couple of steps towards his right and takes the catch just inside the boundary line
slower length ball but way too down the leg side, Morgan lets it go
slower short ball, pulled away towards deep square leg
length ball around off, whips it towards the bowler
length ball around middle, flicked away towards wide long-on. Stokes calls for two and they complete it easily
short of length outside off, punches it towards mid-off for one
length ball on the pads, flicked away towards midwicket for one
length but way outside off, Morgan reaches out for hit and hits it towards sweeper cover
length ball around off, pushed towards long-off from the back foot

dropped by Tamim Iqbal at long-off, Morgan looks to go aerial but doesn't get the distance, Tamim runs towards his right, gets his hands to hit but cannot latch on to. This is now England's highest score in the World Cup
in the slot and Morgan looks to go over long-on this time, ends up hitting it high, Soumya runs in, judges it well as the wind is taking it away, and puts in the dive to complete the catch
fuller around off, drives it towards wide long-off for one

short of length outside off, Stokes looks to go over extra cover but ends up top-edging it towards point, Mashrafe settles under it but fumbles once, twice and finally grabs it diving forward on the third attempt
short of length outside off, a cutter from Mustafizur, Woakes looks to run it down but misses
length ball, another slower one, Woakes backs away and pulls it over deep square leg for a six
fuller and wider outside off this time, Woakes fails to put bat on that
fuller around off, chips it inside out over covers, scampers back for the second, excellent running
fuller around off, clears his front leg and lofts it over wide long-off for another six
length outside off, picks it from there and pulls it between deep midwicket and deep square leg, piercing that small gap for four
length ball on middle and leg and Plunkett brings out another pull, this time behind square leg, four more
fuller outside off, clears his front leg and drills it towards long-off
short of length outside off, backs away and chips it over cover-point for a couple
bowling around the wicket a length ball angling towards the off stump, pushes it towards extra cover
fuller on the stumps, clears his front leg and goes over long-on for another six
fuller around off, throws his bat at it, ends up slicing it over covers
fuller outside off, looks to smash it into oblivion, misses
a yorker outside off, digs it out towards long-off, comes back for the second, a direct-hit at the non-striker's end, but Woakes was home
fuller and wider outside off, clears his front leg and smashes it through extra cover for four
fuller on the stumps and drilled past the non-striker, long-on fielder had no chacne
fuller again, was a slower one, goes over extra cover, comes back for the second
immediate confusion! A tap to cover, Tamim wanted the single, Soumya wasn't paying attention. Has to abort!
pushed onto the back foot, defended back down the track. Very tight line on a tricky length
no hassles this time, tapped to the off side and an easy single
angled across the left-hander, who is early into his drive and inside-edges to midwicket
nudged into the covers, tight line and length
very tight line once again, demanding a respectful push back down the line of the ball. Tidy
tight line and length, cruising onto a full length, Tamim drives from the crease
attempted pull! Whistling short ball, through the stroke before Tamim can line it up!
short again, wider outside off, but no gripes from the umpire. Well bowled again
lovely length, nipping off the deck and patted uneasily out to point off the back foot. Pushed right back into the crease now
beaten for pace outside off! Tamim flirts as the ball sails by
hopping back and across to defend. A maiden to launch his spell. Impressive
lovely line and length, attacking the top of off as Soumya fences at the ball and misses
wide on the crease, tight to off stump again, driven with a closed face to midwicket
hint of width, and out comes the uppercut! Good stuff from Tamim, alert to the opportunity in spite of the pressure, freeing his hands and trusting the eye
slashed uppishly, but bounces short of point!
fuller length, nudged from an off-stump line to square leg. Woakes is a bit miffed they managed to pinch the single there
in the slot outside off, but there's no timing on that uppish thump into the covers. More constrictive work from England's new-ball attack
outside off, edged and did that carry to slip? Sarkar was leaning back, toe-ending a deflection, and it was on the half-volley ... tough chance

absolute beauty! I defy any batsman in the world to play that one! Line, length, nip off the seam at 90mph, bending into the top of off stump, clipping it so finely that the ball balloons over the keeper! Soumya played forwards, but the stump went backwards! Soumya was too deep in his crease to respond, but gosh ... decent nut!
outside off, banged into the deck, through to the keeper
pushed to the on-side
short and wide, Shakib climbs into the slash through the off side, but the ball slips past the stroke before it has formed
round the wicket to tighten the angle, met with a comprehensive wallop to point, but sharply intercepted. Already England's fielding looks sharper than it did against Pakistan
boshed into the covers, hitting on the up but not quite timed as it is hauled back in in the deep
opens the face, pushed into the covers
cracked on the up again, into the covers, but straight at the man
edged, and there's no cutting that one off! Chasing the wider one, a fat edge
a roundhouse wallop, climbing into the short ball and thumped over mid-on
slashed once more on the angle, down to third man. A touch more intent in that over from Bangladesh
bending into the front pad on a full length, punched with a compact stance to mid-off
nudged to mid-off, lots of pace for Archer, and Tamim is content just to stay in line and take the single
a suspicion of width, Shakib clims into the cut but the ball eludes him once more
banged in short, and Shakib ducks
fenced into the off side, full and straight once more
fired into the pads, tucked fine, a single to finish, but another fine and uncollarable over
full length, outside off, met with a dead bat and a sharply snaffled single into the off side
opens the face on a tight line, runs the single to third man
short, hoisted across the line with oodles of intent, not entirely nailed but enough to give the fine leg sweeper some work
opens the face to run another single to third man. Slim pickings
tapped down into the pitch, another tip-and-run single as Woakes gallops through to gather
round the wicket, chopped behind square, Rashid sprints round at third man to cut off the boundary with a tumble
on the back foot, tapped to midwicket, singles are as much as Archer is willing to relinquish at the moment...
full length, clipped to the on side. Areas ... and wheels
short and fast! Shakib sways inside the line like a vision from Sabina Park 1986
cracked with urgency, off the back foot and through the covers. It was the reflexive bat-speed that did the job there. No time for timing ...
on the stumps once more, stabbed defence on the back foot
Tamim is made to hop as Archer gets his line and length tight and aggressive, into the body
a round-house pull to midwicket
walks across the stumps, opens the face with stiff forearms and guides another single to third man
round the wicket now, slower ball outside off, poked out to point with a loud 'no!'
on the legs, tucked to short square. Another single to the cause
outside leg, looped into the pads, Woakes gives chase to gather
round the wicket once more, a bottom-handed bunt into the covers, thoughts of a single but sharp groundwork gets the ball into hand quickly
nudged off the legs, a bit of a scamper as the shy comes in from backward square
sconed! Tamim ducks into the ball, which flicks his shoulder, and zooms to the rope!
more fierce pace on a tight line
turned inside out by a snorter! Tried to duck, decided to stand tall, and the ball zings off the gloves and flies safe!
pulled, with no conviction! Lucky to scuff the shot, as square leg was lurking!
that's more like it! Flicked up, up and away, over the short straight boundary, all the way into the stands! Using the pace, creating the angle!
full and swift, on the leg stump, and nudged square for the single
whipped off the toes, to the leg side
on the leg stump, tickled out of Bairstow's reach for the single
fired down the leg side
not quite on the right line to the left-hander in this over. This one slides past leg stump again
outside off this time, bringing the batsman with him with a bottom-handed flog into the covers, but can't get the timing
on the pads, worked to midwicket. Just a variety of singles in that over
angled bat down to third man
decent line and length, attacking the top of off with that skiddy line. Pushed to the off side
flinched on the up, out to deep cover
lining up the pull but that's too wide of off for a connection
cracked backward of point, past the diving Roy! And if you beat Roy, you tend to beat the field. Excellent shot
chopped down into the pitch, and past the stumps! Tight line and nearly earns the reward!

gallops down the pitch, and holes out to extra cover! Tamim wasn't enjoying himsefl out there, and tried in vain to kick-start his innings with some pre-meditated aggression. It was not to be, a simple spooned catch, and Bangladesh are in some bother now
flicked off the toes, behind square
outside off on a full length, a bit of late nip off the seam, and the recently posted gully was nearly in business there...
tapped off the back foot, straight back down the pitch
hopping back and across, attempted flick out to the leg side, gets enough bat on it to snaffle the single
outside off, and cracked into the covers
worked to the leg side, hopping across the stumps
hitting a solid length outside the left-hander's off stump. Blocked into the covers
walks across the stumps, flicking a leg-stump line to backward square
on the legs again, worked behind square. Very little width to cash in on at the moment
bouncer, and a sharp one too! Shakib tries to pull but the ball is gone
rolls the fingers on a cutter. Defended from the crease
nudged off the pads, this time the cutter doesn't pay dividends, too leg-sided, and eased fine of fine leg
through to the keeper as Mushy shoulders arms outside off
back of a length, dabbed down into the pitch
width outside off, chopped into the covers
down the leg side
forward and fenced into the off side
forward with pad and gloves to the fore, angled down to third man
lifting through to the keeper outside off, beaten for pace
flipped into the leg side
ambitious appeal ... might have pitched outside leg, but clearly thumped the pad in an adjacent position!
bat on ball, with extra bounce outside off. That'll do nicely. Sizzles through third man to the short straight  boundary
hops into line to defend to the off side
on the back foot, defended back down the pitch
poked back to the bowler on a tight line
lifter on leg stump, fenced off the hip
worked back to the bowler once more, tight lines, back of a length
opens the face for a deliberate steer to a wide one outside off. Third man gathers
tucked off the pads, behind square once more
tapped to the off side, this has been a very composed hour from England, who hold all the cards at drinks
length ball around middle and off, Mushfiqur moves across and tickles it towards square leg
slower on middle and leg, 80 kph, flicked away in front of square
almost played on! Length ball around middle and off, Mushfiqur defends it with the soft hands and the ball dribbles towards the off stump, just missing it
length outside off, punched towards deep point off the back foot
a touch fuller this time, comes forward and slashes it towards sweeper cover
a googly, length ball on the pads, glanced towards short fine leg
short but down the leg side, Shakib pulls it down towards fine leg
length ball on middle and leg, flicked away towards deep square leg
length ball around middle and off, turned away towards square leg and that's fifty for Shakib
length ball around off, drops it towards cover with soft hands, Morgan has a shy at the bowler's end but Mushfiqur just makes it
a touch fuller on the stumps, Shakib moves away and scoops it towards fine leg, the fielder is deep
short of length outside off, Mushfiqur goes for the cut and misses
dropped short on middle and leg, Shakib rocks back and pulls it towards deep square leg for four
slower in the air this time, but once again on the leg stump, Shakib skips down and flicks it towards square leg
a touch fuller outside off, comes forward and drives it towards sweeper cover
length ball around off, stays back and punches it towards mid-off
fuller around off, swiped away in front of square on the leg side, to the left of deep midwicket
length ball on the stumps, pushed through, Mushfiqur goes back and punches it towards extra cover
fuller on the stumps, works it towards square leg for a single
length ball on the stumps, goes back and across and flicks it towards square leg
fuller and angling across the left-hander, Shakib looks to go leg side but gets the outer half and it goes aerial towards short third man but well short of the fielder there
fuller around off once again, Shakib comes forward and drives, straight towards extra cover
fuller around off, moves across towards the off stump and flicks it towards square leg
short of length on middle and leg, Mushfiqur pulls it towards fine leg for one
fuller around off, comes down the ground and hits it towards long-off, was in the air for a while but Mushfiqur knew how deep the fielder was
fuller again, Shakib gives himself some room and drives it past the extra cover fielder on his left for four
short in length this time, Shakib once again was backing away, flat-bats it towards mid-off
length ball around off and spinning away, Mushfiqur was looking to run it down, misses
flatter around off, Mushfiqur goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
length ball on the pads, nudges it towards square leg for one more
starts the over with a bouncer, Shakib was in no position to pull it, still goes for it, the ball hits the helmet and goes towards third man
fuller on the pads, flicked away towards deep square leg, Wood tumbles in his followthrough
short of length outside off, Shakib goes up and over backward point, towards the left of Rashid at third man who had no chance to cut it off
length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover from the front foot
length around off, Mushfiqur was stuck at his crease, pushes it towards point in the end
length ball around off, punched past the diving extra cover, he might have got a hand to it, the mid-off fielder cuts it off eventually

a brilliant effort by Roy at extra cover, jumping in the air but perhaps too high as the ball hits him near the wrist, was a length ball around off, Mushfiqur came down the track and looked to clear Roy
fuller on the stumps, misses the flick and gets hit on the pads
fuller on the pads, swept fine for a single, there was a top-edge but lands safe
flighted around off, drives it towards long-off for one
short of length on the stumps, goes back and pulls it into the ground
a big googly from outside leg stump, Shakib knows where his stumps are and lets it go to the keeper
fuller on the stumps this time and driven past Rashid on his left, he was moving to his left, the boundary-riders have no chance to cut it off
short of length outside off, looks to upper cut but doesn't middle it, gets a single though
length ball on the stumps, moves across and flicks it towards square leg
short of length around off, drops it towards covers and sets off for one
short of length outside off, at 147 kph, was looking to run it down, gets beaten by the pace
short of length once again, Shakib moves towards the off side and looks to ramp it over, misses
short of length outside off, dabs it down towards third man
fuller around off, Shakib goes down on one knee and sweeps it towards deep midwicket for four
fuller on middle and leg, drives it towards long-on for one
looks to come down the track but cannot reach the pitch of the ball and is hit on the pads
goes for the reverse sweep to this fuller delivery but ends up hitting straight towards short third man
down the track, reaches to the pitch of the ball and lofts it over mid-on, one-bounce four
length outside off, late-cuts it towards third man for one
loopy bounce outside off, Mushfiqur opens the face of the bat to help it towards third man, falls short of the fielder
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards fine leg
length ball on the pads, flicks it towards fine leg for another single
length ball on the stumps, was looking to work it on the leg side, gets a leading edge down the ground but well short of Plunkett
short outside off, tennis-ball bounce there, Shakib jumps in the air and tries to help it towards third man, misses. He was expecting a wide but he umpire doesn't agree
length ball outside off, chops it down towards third man
length ball on the pads, nudged away towards fine leg
fuller on the stumps, goes for the slog sweep, just wide of mid-on and enough on it for a brace
fuller on the stumps, more conventional this time, driven inside out towards long-off
fuller on the pads, easy single for Shakib who flicks it towards square leg
flighted outside off, 71 kph, Mushfiqur pushes at it, gets an outside edge past the keeper, Archer at third man cuts it off
fuller around off, skips down and hits it hard towards the left of long-off for two more
short of length on middle and leg, tucked away behind square and that single bring up the 100-run stand between these two
length ball around off, stays beside the line and steers it towards point
fuller around off, moves across and scoops it towards fine leg, Adil Rashid there keeps it to one
short of length around off, Shakib swivels and pulls it towards deep midwicket, neat connection there, gets a boundary
fuller on the pads, tucked away towards fine leg

and gone! Jason Roy takes the catch at point, tumbling to his right. A cross-seam length ball around off and middle, Mushfiqur was looking to work it on the leg side, gets a leading edge and Roy does the rest
length ball around off, stays back and steers it towards backward point
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards the bowler
tossed up outside off and spinning away, Mithun looks to go aerial, gets a faint outside edge and Bairstow does well to latch on to it, clinging to his chest
length ball around off, defends it from the crease
length ball down the leg side, flicked towards short fine leg
length ball on the stumps, goes back and cuts it towards point
fuller around off, comes forward and digs it out towards extra cover
length ball on middle and leg, helps it towards fine leg
fuller around off, comes forward and defends it back
length ball around off, steered towards the left of Roy who flungs himself low and makes a two-handed stop
short of length outside off, rises on the top of the bounce and cuts it into the ground, towards point
length ball outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it back towards the bowler
a quicker one on the stumps, gets an inside edge towards short fine leg
fuller on the stumps, goes for the sweep but misses and is hit on the pads
a full toss on the pads but Shakib misses out, only a single to deep square leg
length ball around off, works it towards sweeper cover
length ball on the pads, flicks it behind square for one more
length ball, a slower one down the leg side, glances it towards fine leg and moves to 99 with the single
length ball around off, looks to drop it on the off side, gets an inside edge on to the pads, the ball rolls towards covers as they get a quick single
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards sweeper cover and gets to his hundred off just 95 balls
length ball around off, defended towards cover from the crease
length ball on the pads, flicks it behind square leg for one
short of length outside off, cuts it away up and over backward point, Adil Rashid tidies it up at third man
fuller on the stumps, pushes it inside out towards extra cover
tossed up outside off, waits for it to arrive and pushes it towards extra cover
flatter around off, a late cut towards short third man for one
tossed up on middle and leg, Shakib was moving away but had to defend back towards the bowler
charges down but gets too close to the ball, digs it out towards the bowler
length ball around off, stays back and chips it towards mid-off for one
short of length outside off, cuts it towards third man for one
length ball around off, hops in the air and pushes it towards backward point
a bouncer from Archer, but Mahmudullah had no problem ducking under it
short of length once again, this time near the rib cage, looks to flick it away but gets hit high on the bat
short of length outside off, steers it past point from the back foot
another bouncer, Shakib ducks under and almost slips in an attempt to get out of the way, all well in the end
twirled onto a perfect line and length, a cagey inside-edge is gathered at short backward square
shuffles back and across to chop to point
a big yawning sweep, well in front of square, but Stokes gallops round to swoop on the ball. Sharp work
advancing out of the pitch, eased into the covers
sliding past the leg stump
tossed up, and pushed into the covers

h-u-u-u-g-e air, and a stunning connection! A total sucker ball, right above the eyeline, but Mahmudullah, to his credit, held his stance, checked his swing, and timed the pants off a lofted slog down the ground
leans back to push to cover
worked off the legs, good pace on the ball once more
wicket-to-wicket, dabbed to point, another sharp single
beaten all ends up! A knuckle-ball yorker, skimming past the off stump as Shakib is suckered through the air. Bairstow just about gathers
short and wild! No-one's cutting that one off! Shakib tried to swing into the shot, but couldn't get close on a stepladder
speared into the toes, that's a better line! Squirted out to point
on the back foot, hops back and across to block
back of a length, swinging from a leg-stump line, Stokes sprints after the ball and in doing so, puts them off the single
bashed back at the bowler, gathered in his followthrough
thumped in short, Shakib was advancing early, so he gets away with the wide
fuller and straighter, blocked off the top of off
turns his stance inside-out but can't connect with a ramp
whistles another bouncer through a half-cocked pull. A maiden over
outside off, a thick-edged slash down to third man, gathered with a tumble
crunched on the up! Full face of the bat, drilling through the line of the ball, and skimming it inches over Archer's head at mid-on!
clears the front leg, swings the hips through the line, and belts another boundary through wide long-on. There you go, he's up with rate now!
twisting once more into a pull, through mid-on. A touch of cramp kicking in for Shakib as he finishes his followthrough?
banged in short, dragged down into the gap in the leg side, more supreme timing and placement! This is ballsy batting
speared into the toes, met with a lofted tonk, straight-lined hitting into the covers. Plugs safely in no-man's land
takes a step back, slashes high over backward point, where Root, running back, can't cling on!
flicked out to backward square leg
aimed at the base of the stumps! And that's the end of a magnificent innings! Flicks the toe, deflects into the off bail. Brilliant bowling to end an indomitable stay
this one races away to the rope, a big fat edge through third man
full and straight, angled into the stumps, and solidly blocked
nudged down to third man once more. We're into the final ten, and it's officially damage-limitation time for Bangladesh. Their net run-rare is going to take a hit today...
solid areas once more from Woakes
full and straight, worked back down the pitch into the gap at mid-on
nurdled into the leg side
creamed through the line of the ball, high over long-on. Another slower ball, easily picked and walloped
short, and spanked! A flat-batted mow high over long-off! Like a right-handed Tamim versus Zaheer in 2007 (you all know the shot...)
nudged out to point
cracked hard out to midwicket where two fielders converge and Roy pounces well to intercept
open-faced punch out to deep cover
very full, squeezed down to third man
sharp bouncer, angling down the leg side though. Bairstow half-appeals to distract the umpire from stretching his arms
worked off the toes to the leg side
fired down the leg side
banged in short, outside off, steered to point
fizzes through fine leg, slightly off-line and punished
tucked off the toes, a juggle at short fine leg
on the pads, whipped out to deep square leg
worked out to the leg-side sweeper once more. It's rather drifting to a conclusion now
battered through the line of the ball! That's another dent in the NRR
eased down to long-on for another single

banged in short, into the body, a self-preservatory swat across the line, a spiralling top-edge, and Archer makes no mistake, tumbling at deep backward square! Bangladesh's hopes of reaching 300 take a hit
flicked off the toes out to the leg side
short and aggressive, a top-edged pull plops safe at short square
slower ball, cunningly bowled, rolls the fingers and beats the attempted pull. Stokes returned to over the wicket, incidentally, after encountering difficulties with his footing from round the wicket
nudged to mid-on for another single
pushed back up the pitch, leg-sided, and another tight over ticks by
worked to the leg side
on the hip, flipped behind square
one more pull out to deep midwicket, back of a length but on a tight line
banged in short, an ambitious pull, but can't make contact
slower-ball bouncer, tapped out to deep backward square
leading edge, spirals high into the air, Bairstow sprints backwards and guzzles the chance! An attempted flick off the toes, but Wood's extra pace made it fraught with danger. We're nearly done here
tucked to square leg to get off the mark
back of a length, outside off, chipped in the air, out of the reach of point
bowled him ... no, the bails have stayed on! Down the leg side, under-edged into the crease, hops up into the timbers and despite an audible clunk of wood, the wicket remains intact!

the bails aren't on any longer! That's the solution to the heavy bails 'crisis' ... hit them harder! A heat-seeker of a delivery, spread-eagling off and middle as Saifuddin plays across the line. Stokes didn't appear until the 38th over, but he's suddenly on course for a five-for!
beaten outside off, as Mashrafe stabs with an angled bat outside off, but can't connect
opens the face on a yorker, steered to point
punched into the covers
short and agggressive, and eventfully played by Mashrafe, limboing out of line and deflecting very fine through third man. A fine tumbling stop to intercept the boundary
climbing into the ribs, and flicked with some panache behind square. Cramped on impact, but watched the ball well
angled bat, into the off side
shows all three stumps, inviting the yorker, and biffed with intent into the off side

pounded back through the bowler's followthrough! This is good from Bangladesh, no surrender to futility, just a volley of strokeplay. Wood was collapsing a touch in his followthrough, as he is wont to do, and his outstretched hand can't intercept
pushed onto the back foot, and blocked to cover
leans back for a slap into the covers, but can't beat the field this time
outside off, and deflected down to third man
crashed out to the covers
full length, brings the bat down late on an angle to pick off another single to cover
slower ball, much straighter line, blocked down into the crease
on the legs, worked fine

short and wide, draws the ambitious slap through point, but it's a thin edge to the keeper! Mehidy chooses the valiant way to go - that will please the death-or-glory mob - and England are one wicket from victory
full and straight from round the wicket, poked to short cover
yorker, well bowled
fizzing bouncer, flicked to the keeper, and that's the end of that! That was a savage finale, speared right in at the tailender, who had nowhere to go, and a looping catch was gobbled by Bairstow.
